text: t. Kegel exercises strengthen the pelvic muscles and don't require any equipment. Once you learn how to ""Kegel,"" you can Kegel anywhere. The trick is finding the right muscles to squeeze. Your doctor or nurse can help make sure you are squeezing the right muscles. Your doctor may refer you to a specially trained physical therapist who will teach you to find and strengthen the sphincter muscles.
